1115232685746790400.text:
Following this weekend release, some updates to http://gitbook.com  coming from @github have not been delivered properly.
This issue has now been resolved and future updates will now be handled correctly.
Our apologies to all of our GitHub sync users.

1114504514734784512.text:
We are glad to announce that everything went well and should now be back to normal.
Don’t hesitate to contact us at http://gitbook.com  or alert us via Twitter if you encounter any unexpected behavior.

1114491636694695936.text:
As we are deploying major changes to the platform, some disturbances are expected during the next hour or so on http://www.gitbook.com .
We apologize in advance for the trouble and will be back soon.

1103667622892240896.text:
And it’s gone.
Everything’s back to normal, our apologies about the issue!

1103666363418230784.text: We’re experiencing an issue with accessing documentations. We’re actively working on this and it should be resolved pretty soon. Our apologies about the trouble.

1091289446589362176.text: Eagerly expected, here comes the Comments. A step further for collaboration on GitBook. We can’t wait to hear your feedback :)https://medium.com/gitbook/collaboration-say-hello-to-comments-328ad8d2acf5 …

1082641258772860928.text:
The Blue Bar is dead. Long Live the Control Center.
Our new update is now live, including a brand new UX!

And the full changelog is here:https://docs.gitbook.com/changelog

1075775473177640961.text: This morning (from 2am to noon CEST time), our Legacy version encountered an issue which has caused some 504 errors and login problems. This issue is now fixed. We sincerely apologize about this and are working on solutions to prevent this from happening again.

1070618731406086144.text: We’ve heard you loud and clear, we worked hard in backstage and here’s a first glimpse of something coming soon…pic.twitter.com/v01owYGuvp

1067098625384349696.text: Our Support team tools are currently in maintenance, you may have difficulties to reach us through our website contact form. Our apologies for this delay :(

1048852128968597504.text: [status] Verifying: Verification is currently underway for the maintenance items.http://stspg.io/03e7a2f55?u=ntx85wg0w2fj …

1048830376376905729.text: [status] In Progress: Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.http://stspg.io/03e7a2f55?u=qptwyyq61yxd …

1048226027548434433.text:
A big update is coming on Sunday 10/7!

At 7am UTC and for a couple of hours (estimated), we’ll be running a short maintenance.
Please note that your content will be available but not editable in the meantime.

1040242157230202880.text: New Feature  Shareable links! Let us know if you have any feedback https://medium.com/gitbook/shareable-links-happiness-is-only-real-when-shared-privately-5299ea8d9d76 …

1036702028096069638.text: You can now resolve editing conflicts in GitBook!https://medium.com/gitbook/you-can-now-resolve-editing-conflicts-in-gitbook-f9dc7d616a4f …

1025078633063301120.text: The GitHub sync issue has now been solved. Our apologies for the inconvenience. If you’re still having an issue, please contact our support team here or by email (support@)

1025017273076076553.text: We are aware of an issue affecting the GitHub Sync. Our team is fully focused on the matter and we’ll keep you posted on this as soon as we have more to share.

1019734606977880070.text: Finally, we would like to take this opportunity to remind that the content of books hosted on GitBook come from our users, and that you, as a reader, should stay attentive to the legitimacy of the books you browse, just like you would do on the rest of the Web :)

1019734432532574209.text:
The GitBook platform as whole is still safe to use. And it’s safe to visit the great majority of the books on GitBook as well.

We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. Feel free to contact us here, or by email if you have any question.

1019734172682866689.text: We are aware of the security warning provided by Google. It was triggered by a few books created by malicious users, containing spam content and links to unsafe sites. We have blocked the books and users in question.

1019245083995058176.text: We are experiencing a few issues and you may be unable to access or use the service as usual. Our team is fully dedicated to solve this as soon as possible.

951073243682824192.text: We’ve deployed an update/fix to our hosting platform that should resolve any SSL renewal errors on custom domains.

951045327183925249.text: Working on a fix for custom GitBook domains (over HTTPS) impacted by the LetsEncrypt incident: https://letsencrypt.status.io/
